Types

Data = object
  case kind: DataKind
  of stringData:
      m_val: MDBX_val

  of int32Data:
      m_i32: int32

  of int64Data:
      m_i64: int64
A wrapper around a libmdbx key or value, which is just a pointer and length. Data is automatically convertible to and from string and integer types, so you normally won't use it directly.   Source   Edit 
NoData_t = distinct int
  Source   Edit 
DataOut = object
  val*: MDBX_val

A wrapper around a returned libmdbx key or value, which is just a pointer and length. DataOut is automatically convertible to and from string and integer types, so you normally won't use it directly.

IMPORTANT: A DataOut value is valid only until the end of the Snapshot or Transaction within which is was created. After that, the data it points to may be overwritten.

  Source   Edit 
PutFlag = enum
  Insert,                   ## Don't replace existing entry with same key
  Update,                   ## Don't add a new entry, only replace existing one
  Append,                   ## Optimized write where key must be the last in the collection
  AllDups,                  ## Remove any duplicate keys (can combine with ``Update``)
  NoDupData,                ## Don't create a duplicate key/value pair
  AppendDup                  ## Same as Append, but for ``DuplicateKeys`` collections
  Source   Edit 
PutFlags = set[PutFlag]
Options for put operations.   Source   Edit

proc get(snap: CollectionSnapshot; key: Data): DataOut {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Looks up the value of a key in a Collection. Returns the value, or nil Data if not found. As with all "get" operations, the value is valid (the memory it points to will be unchanged) until the enclosing Snapshot finishes. It points into the memory-mapped database, not a copy.   Source   Edit 
proc `[]`(snap: CollectionSnapshot; key: Data): DataOut {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Syntactic sugar for get.   Source   Edit 
proc getGreaterOrEqual(snap: CollectionSnapshot; key: Data): (DataOut, DataOut) {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Finds the first key greater than or equal to key. If found, returns its value and updates key to the actual key. If not found, returns nil Data and sets key to nil.   Source   Edit 
proc get(snap: CollectionSnapshot; key: Data; fn: proc (val: openArray[char])): bool {...}{.
    discardable, raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Looks up the value of a key in a Collection; if found, it passes it to the callback function as an openarray, without copying, then returns true. If not found, the callback is not called, and the result is false.   Source   Edit 
proc put(t: CollectionTransaction; key: Data; value: Data) {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Stores a value for a key in a Collection. If a value existed, it will be replaced. If value points to nil, the key/value is deleted.   Source   Edit 
proc `[]=`(t: CollectionTransaction; key: Data; value: Data) {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Syntactic sugar for a simple put.   Source   Edit 
proc insert(t: CollectionTransaction; key: Data; val: Data): bool {...}{.
    raises: [CatchableError, MDBXError], tags: [].}
Adds a new key and its value; if the key exists, does nothing and returns false. (Same as put with the Insert flag.)   Source   Edit 
proc update(t: CollectionTransaction; key: Data; val: Data): bool {...}{.
    raises: [CatchableError, MDBXError], tags: [].}
Replaces an existing value for a key in a Collection; If the key doesn't already exist, does nothing and returns false. (Same as put with the Update flag.)   Source   Edit 
proc append(t: CollectionTransaction; key: Data; val: Data) {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Adds a key and value to the end of the collection. This is faster than put, and is useful when populating a Collection with already-sorted data. The key must be greater than any existing key, or MDBX_EKEYMISMATCH will be raised. (Same as put with the Append flag.)   Source   Edit 
proc put(t: CollectionTransaction; key: Data; value: Data; flags: PutFlags): bool {...}{.
    raises: [CatchableError, MDBXError], tags: [].}
Stores a value for a key in a Collection, according to the flags given. If the write was prevented because of a flag (for example, if Insert given but a value already exists) the function returns false. Other errors are raised as exceptions.   Source   Edit 
proc put(t: CollectionTransaction; key: Data; valueLen: int; flags: PutFlags;
         fn: proc (val: openArray[char])): bool {...}{.
    raises: [CatchableError, MDBXError], tags: [].}
Stores a value for a key in a Collection. The value is filled in by a callback function. This eliminates a memory-copy inside libmdbx, and might save you some allocation. If the write was prevented because of a flag (for example, if Insert given but a value already exists) the function returns false instead of calling the callback.   Source   Edit 
proc putDuplicates(t: CollectionTransaction; key: Data; values: openArray[byte];
                   valueCount: int; flags: PutFlags) {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Stores multiple values for a single key. The collection must use DupFixed, i.e. have multiple fixed-size values. values must contain all the values in contiguous memory.   Source   Edit 
proc del(t: CollectionTransaction; key: Data): bool {...}{.discardable,
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Removes a key and its value from a Collection. Returns true if the key existed, false if it doesn't exist.   Source   Edit 
proc delAll(t: CollectionTransaction) {...}{.raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError],
                                        tags: [].}
Removes all keys and values from a Collection, but does not delete the Collection itself.   Source   Edit 
proc deleteCollection(t: CollectionTransaction) {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Deletes the Collection itself, including all its keys and values.   Source   Edit
